title: The nerfs won't affect good Ahri players
body:
The Ahri players that know how to land charms consistently will not be feeling those nerfs as hard. The changes are more towards phasing out the people who abuse Ahri's point and click burst on her ult and W, while giving her better counterplay. 

Ahri's play was too rewarding and forgiving for sloppy players at the cost of other champions. This is just a step in the right direction.

People are mostly concerned with the single target burst damage: in which case W is a 16% nerf, R is a 15% nerf, and E is 10% buff.

Technically it varies.

The damage difference for single target is 21% AP scaling reduction.
2 Targets is 42% scaling Reduction.
3 Targets is a whopping 65% AP scaling reduction.

However note that because damage was shifted from W into E, where E has anywhere from 1.5-2.4 times as long of a CD her DPS throughout a teamfight takes a significant beating at a 24-50% AP scaling loss based on the number of targets she would hit with W compared to landing an E over the duration of her E CD.

ya know, Ahri has a huge tradeoff for that gap closer. 

It's range and targeting, only a single one of her abilities is actually easy to hit, the others either have short range or get blocked frequently.  And it's very transparent. 


And the one spell that is easy to hit....is only easy provided her target isn't moving.

Those are the reasons she was never on top of the foodchain in the midlane, what has caused her to rise gradually however is the fact that all of the others have been nerfed.  With old LB and Swain gone Ahri´s worst counters where out of the game. 


Naturally she got stronger for it, but what really caused issue's is that it was made impossible to rush magic resist as a mage without becoming a cripple for mana.  Same for armor really, that is why most mages can't handle assassins, it's too difficult to gain the resistance needed to survive and still not lose the ability to be useful after losing one or two rotations.

So what happens when a hybrid mage/assassin or just pure assassin loses his/her counters? An open field to go freely, it´s not something unexpected.  But naturally people will be frustrated, a champion able to excel in such a variety of situations like Ahri is currently is naturally something that people will direct their frustrations at,  And truly, her W-R-R-R with Thunderlord and luden+high AP or just with gunblade and lichbane-thunderlord is actually too strong for a rotation without skillshots.

And thus it was good that Riot moved strength from her W to her E. 

But her R nerf might have been too much, it´s fine to make it easier to counterplay her by moving damage to her slow E but straight out cutting down her damage on the ulti will hurt her ability to actually be able to threaten her opponents.  ¨


Thus i think that some form of compensation should be added, like a bit more effectiveness out of her passive or R getting a little more dash length back (it was nerfed in the past). 

Not that i mind too much seeing how i mainly play Malz and Syndra for mid currently, i just worry that if all the competition dies of people will start looking at my champs instead again x)
